cyclone.name: KAY
cyclone.current_location: about 200 miles west of the southern tip of Baja California
cyclone.trajectory: tracking north-northwest parallel to the Baja California peninsula and then curving just offshore of southern California
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: west-central coast of the Baja California peninsula (near Punta Eugenia)

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Ensenada to the U.S./Mexico border (Mexican side only)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Punta Abreojos southward to Cabo San Lucas and San Jose De Las Palomas to Ensenada (west coast of Baja California)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire west coast of the Baja California peninsula and, by swell and rainfall, the southern California coast
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (8% cumulative) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts to gale force possible Friday into early Saturday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Large southerly swells may produce minor coastal flooding and hazardous surf/rip currents rather than a true storm-surge inundation.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain possible with localized totals to 6 inches, creating a flash-flood risk in the San Diego area Friday–Saturday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents that could disrupt small-craft and passenger-ferry operations.
